channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MJAVADOC-793] java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.length()" because "text" is null
item.project: Maven Javadoc Plugin (Moved to GitHub Issues)
item.description:
Plugin throws NullPointerException when running javadoc:javadoc.

See:

  • Failing PR: https://github.com/apache/commons-compress/pull/528
  • Build log: https://github.com/apache/commons-compress/actions/runs/9113449616/job/25054982405?pr=528

Or:

  1. git clone https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf/commons-compress.git
  2. git checkout 542cc5a602a9128932e3fb75503383e481141e7e
  3. Edit pom.xml and set the parent POM to version 70
  4. Run 'mvn javadoc:javadoc' causes:
[INFO] --- javadoc:3.6.3:javadoc (default-cli) @ commons-compress ---

My local env:

Apache Maven 3.9.6 (bc0240f3c744dd6b6ec2920b3cd08dcc295161ae)

item.summary: java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "String.length()" because "text" is null

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi,

Any thoughts on pushing out a release sooner rather than later?
ggregory when we will have a fix I can release next version
A possible low-level fix: https://github.com/codehaus-plexus/plexus-xml/pull/29

I consider this report as bogus:

(f) links = [null, https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/, https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/apidocs, https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/apidocs]

The null comes from:

        <plugin>
          <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId>
          <version>3.6.3</version>
          <configuration>
            <source>1.8</source>
            <quiet>true</quiet>
            <encoding>iso-8859-1</encoding>
            <docencoding>iso-8859-1</docencoding>
            <linksource>true</linksource>
            <links>
              <link>${commons.javadoc8.java.link}</link>
              <link>https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/6/api/</link>
              <link>https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-codec/apidocs</link>
              <link>https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-io/apidocs</link>
            </links>

${commons.javadoc8.java.link} isn't defined anywhere.

For me the behavior is correct. SISO.
I would expect a missing value in an XML document to map to an empty string or no-op at worst, not an NPE which is completely undecipherable to a user.
Even if, I still prefer to fix the source and then I'd think about the marshaler.
Moreover commons.javadoc8.java.link is redundant because this plugin can provide this as well, if you want to.
Another wrinkle is that modern Javadoc tool versions no longer let you point to Java 8 and instead issue a warning and replace the link to Java 22 Javadoc (if you're on Java 22 for example).
sjaranowski, is a bump in Plexus XML sufficient?

Yes and no from me:

The actual problem is gone, now it surfaces what I have written to ggregory, SISO: shit it, shit out.
This project has moved from Jira to GitHub Issues. This issue was migrated to apache/maven-javadoc-plugin#1169.
